references.paper_title: Neural additive models: Interpretable machine learning with neural nets
references.reason: This paper proposes Neural Additive Models (NAMs), a novel approach to interpretable machine learning that combines the accuracy of neural networks with the interpretability of additive models, which is directly compared to the proposed method in the paper.

references.paper_title: "why should i trust you?": Explaining the predictions of any classifier
references.reason: This paper introduces LIME, a widely used technique for explaining the predictions of black-box machine learning models, which is used as a baseline for comparison in evaluating the interpretability of the proposed method.

references.paper_title: A unified approach to interpreting model predictions
references.reason: This paper presents SHAP (SHapley Additive exPlanations), a game-theoretic approach to explaining individual predictions, which is used as a baseline to assess the interpretability and fairness of the proposed IMN method.

references.paper_title: Synthetic benchmarks for scientific research in explainable machine learning
references.reason: This paper introduces XAI-Bench, a benchmark for evaluating the explainability of machine learning models, used to assess the interpretability of the proposed IMN method against other state-of-the-art methods.

references.paper_title: Revisiting deep learning models for tabular data
references.reason: This paper provides strong baselines for predictive performance on tabular data using deep learning models, which are compared against the proposed IMN approach to assess its predictive accuracy.
